page.title: 09Power,Wick
page.content: In 1965, the Hydro Electric Station, which replaced a generating station, started to be used as the main power source of electricity from the National grid, for Wick and the surrounding area.This area covers the whole of Caithness and the north of Sutherland.From the station the total power output is 11000 kilowatts.Here the voltage is stepped down and is transmitted by underground cables for domestic use.Generally the peak hour of usage is 5.00pm. The station, which is situated just outside Wick, is conveniently close to the main road.There is a line with a low voltage, which is used for men to practise on.During winter the main cause of power cuts is the weight of ice causing not only cables but also telegraph poles to snap.
